title: Late-night hosts take on Melania Trump's documentary. See their jokes
shortDescription: Melania Trump's documentary got dragged by late-night hosts this week. Who played the first lady on Colbert? Why did Jimmy Kimmel allege rigging?

title: Trump unveils plans to 'rededicate America as one nation under God'
shortDescription: President Trump announced plans for a national prayer event at the National Mall in May to "rededicate America as one nation under God."

title: TrumpRx, a direct-to-consumer prescription drug website, set to launch
shortDescription: The prices would reflect discounts the White House said it has negotiated with more than a dozen drug companies under the "most favored nation."

title: Trump makes it easier to hire and fire 50,000 federal workers
shortDescription: Trump campaigned on a pledge to strip job protections from federal workers deemed by the president's team to be 'influencing' government policy.

title: Trump: I 'probably should make it' into heaven
shortDescription: President Donald Trump spoke at the National Prayer Breakfast, saying he "probably should make it" into heaven.

title: Trump endorses candidate for Marjorie Taylor Greene's seat in Georgia
shortDescription: Clay Fuller, a Republican candidate running to replace Marjorie Taylor Greene in Georgia, was endorsed by President Trump. Who else does Trump support

title: Trump, at prayer breakfast, says he ‘probably should’ get into heaven
shortDescription: Speaking at the National Prayer Breakfast, Trump said he "probably should" get into heaven and questioned how any person of faith can vote Democratic.

title: RFK Jr. admits he can't get Trump to eat healthy
shortDescription: Kennedy referred to the "refined carbohydrates and ultra processed foods" contained in the foods the president likes as "just poison."

title: Bill Gates says he 'regrets every minute' spent with Jeffrey Epstein
shortDescription: In an interview with Nine News Australia, the Microsoft co-founder said he "regrets every minute" spent with the disgraced financier.

title: Poll: Most want Supreme Court to rule against Trump on tariffs, Fed
shortDescription: Large majorities of the public want the Supreme Court to rule against Trump's tariffs and against his attempt to fire Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve.

title: Democrats clash with Treasury Sec. Bessent
shortDescription: A congressional hearing with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent grew heated as Democrats argued he didn't answer questions directly.

title: 7 states tinkering with congressional maps as California offsets Texas
shortDescription: Seven states continue to tinker with congressional maps for partisan advantage in the 2026 elections after the Supreme Court upheld California's plan.

title: Trump says Iranian leader 'should be very worried'
shortDescription: Trump issued a new warning to Iran and its supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, ahead of expected talks over Tehran's nuclear program.

title: Has Savannah Guthrie interviewed Donald Trump? See their history
shortDescription: President Donald Trump called Savannah Guthrie after her mother Nancy Guthrie had been missing for days. See his past interviews with the 'Today' host.

title: Trump: 'We can use a little bit of a softer touch'
shortDescription: In an interview with NBC News, President Donald Trump said his administration "can use a little bit of a softer touch" when it comes to immigration.

title: ICE will 'surround the polls' in 2026, former Trump advisor says
shortDescription: President Trump has called for the Republican party and the federal government to take control of local elections as polls show Democratic gains.

title: Trump says Iran's supreme leader 'should be worried' about U.S. armada
shortDescription: Trump issued a new warning to Iran and its supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, ahead of expected talks over Tehran's nuclear program.

title: Trump calls Savannah Guthrie as search for her missing mother intensifies
shortDescription: The president called the "Today" co-anchor as the search for her missing mother in Arizona enters its fourth day.
